content.description: Central Perk, Joey, Chandler, Monica, and Phoebe are there. Joey is holding a deck of cards out to Chandler.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, pick a card.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay. (He picks the 9 of Spades)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right now, memorize it. (Pause) You got it?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yes.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Is that your card? (He winks and smiles.)
content.parenthetical: holding up the Queen of Clubs

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes.
(Joey laughs then realizes the trick didn’t work when Chandler hands him his card back.)

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Hey guys!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi there!

content.speaker: Ben
content.text: Hi!!

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Guess what? Ben is going to be in a TV commercial!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What are you talking about?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, it’s not for sure but umm, we met this guy in the park who thought Ben was really cute—y’know, which he is—so umm anyhoo, he uh, he gave us his card and told us to bring him down for this commercial he’s auditioning.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoa! This guy is like the biggest commercial casting director in town! (Ross gasps) Ben takes one lousy walk in the park and gets an audition!! (Ross and Carol stare at him, then Joey realizes what he just said.) I mean, way to go Ben! (Gives Ben the thumbs up, which Ben returns.) Man! I’ve been in that park a million times and no one offered me an audition.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I know, it’s crazy! We were just pushing Ben on the swings…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m always on the swings! What am I doing wrong?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, everyone is eating breakfast, Ross is heading for the bathroom.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, gotta go! Wish me luck!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Luck!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey Rach, now that you’re working at Ralph Lauren , can you bring me back some of those polo shirts?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh well, y’know what? I don’t think if I feel comfortable stealing on my very first day…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Unwilling to steal from work, interesting.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Besides, if anybody’s gonna get free stuff, it’s gonna be me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay guys, way to wish me luck!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Good luck! Go get ’em! (Rachel exits.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, let’s discuss Rachel’s birthday. I say we throw a surprise party this weekend.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoa-whoa, but her birthday isn’t like for another month.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah but if we throw her a party on her birthday, then it’s not a surprise.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I think it’s a great idea. Yeah, we could have a dinner party and just invite her close friends.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ross!! We’re having a surprise party for Rachel!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Done.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, great so do you want to do it together?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I would love to do it together!
(Joey starts to giggle.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: They’re gonna do it together.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Dude! That’s my girlfriend!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What, so I gotta shut it down now?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right, I gotta take off. I’m picking up Ben then we’re off to the big audition.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s gonna be weird to watch some actor pretending to be Ben’s dad.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Weirder than watching his two moms make out? (Monica nods in agreement.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoa-whoa dad? There’s a dad in the commercial?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah the dad and Ben eat soup and pretend to enjoy it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoa, hey, maybe I’ll go down there with ya and see if I can get an audition to play the dad. I mean who better to play Ben’s father than his godfather.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’re not his godfather.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?! Are you kidding?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Of course I am! (Joey is relieved) Okay, let’s go godfather.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right!
(As they walk out he motions to Chandler that he is still Ben’s godfather.)

content.description: Ben’s audition, Carol, Ross, and Ben along with about 10 more families are in a waiting room as Joey enters happily.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! I’m in, they’re gonna let me audition!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Really? That’s great!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know! I know! It turns out that one of the casting ladies has actually seen me in a play, so I steered clear of her…

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Hey, that kid looks familiar.
content.parenthetical: noticing a kid who has picked up a copy of Variety to read

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh yeah, yeah! He’s done tons of commercials. I’ve seen him in like Sugar Smacks, Playstation , and that one for the phone company. In fact he was so good in that one, he actually convinced me to switch phone companies. Chandler was mad…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah well, he’s not gonna get this one. Ben is way cuter than that kid. I mean look at him, look at you, (Starts to whine like a baby and Joey just glares at him.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s great. Listen, wouldn’t it be great though if I got to play Ben’s dad?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Joey, you look nothing like Ben.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I look more like him than you do! (He winks at Carol.)

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Y’know, I don’t really know you well enough for you to do that.

content.description: Rachel’s new job, she’s in her new boss’s office (Kim’s) and with the other assistant (Nancy). Together they’re deciding what clothes to buy or something, who knows, let’s all watch/read to find out.

content.speaker: Kim
content.text: So it’s down to these two, Nancy I know you like this one and I think I agree. Rachel, what do you think?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well umm, that one is pretty but uh, I just, I just love this fabric (On the other one.) Sorry.

content.speaker: Kim
content.text: Oh don’t be sorry, that’s part of your job here to give your opinions and then I take credit for them—I’m kidding.

content.speaker: Nancy
content.text: She is kidding, but don’t ever disagree with her again. Okay, now I’m kidding!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, what a fun office.

content.speaker: Kim
content.text: I don’t know which one, but I do know I need a cigarette. So what do you say we take a break, we go outside, and we’ll figure this out when we come back?
(They all get up to leave.)

content.speaker: Kim
content.text: Rachel? Do you smoke?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh no, my dad’s a doctor and he would always tell me just horror stories…(stops and tries to change directions)…about ghosts and goblins who totally supported the princess’s right to smoke.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel is telling Chandler and Monica about her day.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: …and then they came back from smoking and they had made all of the decisions without me!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That doesn’t seem fair.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know! It’s like I’m being punished for not having this disgusting, poisoning habit!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, it is the best.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I mean what if this keeps happening? Y’know, they’ll-they’ll be outside smoking, making all the decisions and I’ll just be up in my office breathing my stupid clean air, y’know? And then when the day comes when Kim wants to promote one of us, who do you think she’s gonna pick? Me or Smokey Smokerson?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rachel, you can go down there, you don’t have to smoke. Just say you wanna get some fresh air.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, I can do that.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, or you can do the easy thing and smoke.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey Rach, you wanna get some coffee?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I would love to!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh good!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, I wanna go to babe.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh good.
(They all start out.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh wait, I change my mind! (She slams the door on them.) Okay, let’s talk about the party! I have so many ideas! (Holds up a cocktail napkin.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, me too! (Runs and grabs her 3-ring binder of ideas.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, look at that.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, that’s a little sketch of the cake, umm some sample menus, umm y’know what I thought we would start out with Tuscan style finger food, and for music, here’s an alphabetized list of all my CDs! I’ve highlighted the ones that would go really good with the food.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What happened to the intimate dinner party?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, we’re not doing that. Okay…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So wow, it looks like you took care of everything. Thanks a lot, co-host.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?! I didn’t take care of everything, there’s-there’s plenty of things for you to do!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Like what?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Cups.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Cups? You’re giving me cups?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And ice!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Cups and ice? Ooh, I get to be in charge of cups and ice? (Thinks of something) All right. Fine, okay, I will be in charge of cups and ice!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wait a minute, I can get ice at the restaurant…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I got it! Mine!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey! How’d the audition go?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Not so good.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wait a minute, are you doing Joey’s (sadly) “Audition didn’t go so well. (Happily) Yeah it did?”

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah I am! Yeah, Ben got a second audition!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, I had to teach Ross my bit because I actually didn’t get a callback.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You got a callback too didn’t you?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah I did!

content.description: The smoker’s balcony, Rachel is out to join Kim and Nancy.

content.speaker: Kim
content.text: Hey Rachel, what are you doing out here?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh well, it’s kinda lonely up there, so I just thought I would come out here and get some fresh air.

content.speaker: Kim
content.text: Nancy and I were talking about the fall collection.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh great!

content.speaker: Kim
content.text: So anyway we really… (Someone exhales and Rachel turns and coughs.) Honey, we’re just smoking all over you.

content.speaker: Nancy
content.text: Oh, sorry!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh that’s okay.

content.speaker: Kim
content.text: No-no-no, we’ll move you just stay right there. (They walk away.)

content.speaker: Nancy
content.text: So anyway I sent the designs over to Ralph and he’s very excited about the line.

content.speaker: Kim
content.text: Oh that’s great! You are the best!
(Rachel gets fed up and heads over to another smoker.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Excuse me, can I, can I bum one of those? (He holds up his pack.) Y’know what, actually… (She takes the one he’s smoking and heads over to where Nancy and Kim are standing and laughing.) Okay, okay, okay, what’s so funny over here?

content.speaker: Nancy
content.text: I thought you didn’t smoke.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I thought you guys meant marijuana cigarettes, y’know? Y’know what I mean, like dubbies? And I actually, I thought to myself, “Wow, those guys are crazy!” But no, I actually smoke the regular ones all, all the time.

content.speaker: Kim
content.text: We get high.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, me too.

content.speaker: Kim
content.text: I’m kidding.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, me too.

content.description: Ben and Joey’s (Isn’t that an ice cream??) callback.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh God, this is so nerve wracking! How-how do you do this?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, unfortunately, I don’t get many callbacks so…

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Is it a good sign that they asked us to hang around after the audition?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Who knows?

content.speaker: The Casting Director
content.text: Okay uh, we have narrowed it down to Raymond, Ben, Kyle, and Joey. The rest of you, thank you very much.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes!! I knew it!! (To the people who didn’t make it.) Bye-bye! So long! Later!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh this is great! I might actually get to play Ben’s dad!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: The Casting Director
content.text: Actually, that can’t happen. Yeah because you all have such different looks, we’re putting you with Raymond and Kyle with Ben. So it’ll be either you two (Points to Joey and Raymond) or you two. (Points to Kyle and Ben.) (Exits.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Man, this is gonna be kinda weird.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, it is.

content.speaker: Kyle
content.text: Yeah. It’s gonna be weird.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, we-we’re gonna be like best friends, that’s why it’s gonna be weird.

content.speaker: Kyle
content.text: Oh, oh, I thought we were just talking.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Ross and Chandler are talking.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross and Chandler
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Is it okay if I leave this stuff here ’til Rachel’s birthday party?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ah sure. What’s in ’em?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm, cups.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh good, because uh we got Rachel 800 gallons of water.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Seriously that’s a lot of cups.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah well, that’s ’cause Monica put me in charge of cups and ice, and Monica is gonna rue the day that she put me in charge of cups and ice.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know I rued the day once…didn’t get a whole lot else done.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, time to bring up the rest of the cups. (She goes and opens the door to Joey.) Oh, hi Joey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Pheebs! (To the guys) Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ross good, I’m uh glad you’re here. I wanna talk to you about something.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What’s up?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, I’ve been thinking about this whole commercial thing, y’know me going up against Ben, the two of us competing, and that can’t lead to anything good. So, I think I’m just gonna step aside. I’m gonna tell them that I won’t audition.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wow, uh, Joey that’s-that’s great. Thanks man.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s it? You’re-you’re gonna let me do this?! This-this is my career we’re talking about here!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, you just…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I just said that so you wouldn’t let Ben do it! Look Ross, if anyone should step aside it should be Ben!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What? Chandler! Tell ’em!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well I mean, let me get the door first. (Goes and opens the door.) Oh, hi! No one. (Exits.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Why should Ben step aside? It was his audition in the first place! You-you just tagged along! You’re like the uh, tag-a-long dad.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: At least I care about his feelings!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Do you know how hard this is gonna be on him when he doesn’t get it?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And why wouldn’t he get it?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, come on! Have you seen what my kid can do?! Huh?! I mean he dials phones! He-he-he eats tortilla chips! He-he plays soccer with the cartoon tiger!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Are you saying your kid eats soup better than my kid?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You just give him a spoon baby!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh yeah? I guess we’ll just see!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! Because this commercial belongs to me and Mitch!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’re kid’s name is Raymond!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah?! So’s yours!

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler and Monica are there as Rachel enters.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How did work go?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh it was great! It was great! I went down there just like you said, y’know? And we talked business. Kim totally took my opinions.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You stink!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thanks!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, I’m-I’m serious!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well-well that’s ’cause I went down there and they were all smoking. This is actually the smell of success.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, there’s something different though—Oh my God! You smoked!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I did not!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes you did! You look happy and sick; you smoked!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, fine! But I had too! I had to do it for my career!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I wish I had smoked for my career…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s so gross!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No well, no it’s not that bad, y’know? I mean yeah, my tongue feels a little fuzzy and these fingers sort of smell, I actually feel like I can throw up.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, but you gotta push past this because it is about to get so good!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler! I have to tell you, you smell so smokey I have to get up. I’m not kidding. (She’s not; she stands and walks away. Chandler moves closer.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I think you smell great! (He sniffs her shoulder.)

content.description: The smoker’s balcony, Rachel, Kim, and Nancy are all puffing away on their cancer sticks.

content.speaker: Kim
content.text: So, we’re decided, no on plaid, yes on pink?

content.speaker: Nancy
content.text: Absolutely!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I am so on board! (She throws away her recently lit cigarette.)

content.speaker: Kim
content.text: Rachel didn’t you just light that?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, I did, but y’know what? I am really, really trying to cut back, y’know? (Laughs) Good luck, Rach.

content.speaker: Nancy
content.text: I’ve actually been thinking about quitting lately.

content.speaker: Kim
content.text: Oh sure, every Sunday night I’m telling myself I’m quitting but every Monday morning it’s like (Mimics chain smoking.)

content.speaker: Nancy
content.text: Tell me about it!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well then let’s just quit! We’ll just quit! Let’s all quit!

content.speaker: Kim
content.text: It does sound appealing.

content.speaker: Nancy
content.text: Oh, I never could do it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh but you could. You can. Absolutely! We can help each other out! We can get—what are those—those patches! We could be like the Patch Sisters!

content.speaker: Kim
content.text: Oh y’know, we really should quit. Okay, let’s quit!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes! Great! Give me those cigs! Give it! Give it! (She grabs their cigarettes and lighters and throws them in the trash.)

content.speaker: Kim
content.text: My late husband gave me that lighter. (Rachel laughs.) I’m not kidding.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay then! (She starts rummaging through the trash to find Kim’s lighter.)

content.description: [Scene: Joey and Ben’s audition, Joey is rehearsing his lines, uh correction, Joey is rehearsing his line.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hmmm, soup! (Tries again.) Hmm soup! (Tries again, with a little caveman thrown in.) Hmm, soup!

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Joey, Ross is gonna be here any second, would you mind watching Ben for me while I use the ladies’ room?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh yeah, no problem.

content.speaker: Carol
content.text: Thanks. (Exits.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hi Ben! So you wanna be an actor huh? I gotta tell ya, it’s no picnic. There’s tons of rejection. No stability. One day you’re Dr. Drake Remoray, the next day you’re eating ketchup right out of the bottle.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Joey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ross!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ben! (Pause.) (Happily.) I mean, Ben! Ben!

content.speaker: The Casting Director
content.text: Okay, Raymond, Joey you’re up.
(Raymond and Joey go in the office.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: The Casting Director
content.text: Okay, uh well, let’s try one. Whenever you guys are ready. (Some dude puts down a couple bowls of soup in front of them.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh-oh.

content.speaker: The Casting Director
content.text: Is there a problem?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well this is noodle soup and uh, I’ve been working with tomato. But that’s okay, no problem. No problem. Hmm, noodle soup.

content.speaker: The Casting Director
content.text: Y’know, that’s-that’s fine, but the line is, “Hmm, soup.”

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, what did I say?

content.speaker: The Casting Director
content.text: Hmm, noodle soup.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: How’s that different? (She looks at him until he gets it.) Oh! Yeah!

content.speaker: The Casting Director
content.text: All right, let’s try one.
(Raymond and Joey both eat a spoonful and Joey turns to Raymond and says…)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hmm, noodle soup.

content.speaker: The Casting Director
content.text: Okay. Let’s do it again.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay.
(They do it again.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hmm, soup. (Pause.) I mean, noodle soup. I mean soup!

content.speaker: Raymond
content.text: COME ON!!!!

content.speaker: The Casting Director
content.text: Y’know what? We need to move on.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No! No! I-I can do it one more time! See? Look! (Eats another spoonful) Hmm, noodle soup. Damnit! (Storms out.)

content.description: The smoker’s balcony, Kim and Nancy are cheating and are caught by Rachel.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey! Hey-hey-hey!!

content.speaker: Kim
content.text: Uh-oh, busted!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Come on you guys! What are doing?! I thought we were the patch sisters!

content.speaker: Kim
content.text: Yeah. That didn’t work out.

content.speaker: Nancy
content.text: Rachel we tried to quit, but it was too hard!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well y’know if you, if you started smoking again you could’ve at least told me! Come on, give me one of those! What are we talking about?

content.speaker: Kim
content.text: No. No! You’re doing great! Don’t you give up! That’s why we didn’t tell you and we’re not gonna drag you down with us.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh wait, no-no-no! Drag me down. Drag-drag me down.

content.speaker: Kim
content.text: Forget it Rachel! We’re both so proud of how well you’re doing. I’m not gonna let you blow it. In fact, if I catch you with a cigarette, you’re fired. So go on, get out of here! Go on, I don’t want you breathing this stuff! Go on!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. (Starts to walk away.)

content.speaker: Kim
content.text: So, okay! So you’ll come with me on the Paris trip.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh man!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel’s surprise party. The apartment is festooned with cups. There are cups everywhere! Cup centerpiece, cup garland, etc., etc

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Check it out! Cup hat! (Points to her hat.) Cup banner! Cup chandelier! And the thing that started it all, the cup! (Holds up one.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Great job with the cups, Pheebs!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why don’t you just go out with her!
(Chandler starts to follow her into the kitchen.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: And did you notice the ice? (Gestures to 3 huge buckets of ice on the table.) Look! We have it all! We have crushed! Cubed! And dry! Watch! (Pours some water onto the dry ice, causing it to evaporate/smoke.) Ahhh! Mystical!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Awesome!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chandler! Everyone—no one’s eating my Tuscan finger food ’cause they’re all filling up on Phoebe’s snow cones!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: There are snow cones! (Monica glares at him.) Snow cones! Yuck!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know…go! Go! Right there! (Points)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Thank you! Thank you! (Runs to the snow cone machine.)
(Rachel enters.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, look! Look! Look!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Surprise!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?! What?! My birthday’s not for another month!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s the surprise!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God! You guys this is so great! I mean it’s so unexpected! I mean Chandler’s birthday is even before mine!
(Everyone stops and looks at Chandler, who’s nodding.)

content.speaker: All
content.text: Surprise!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow! This is great! Look at all these cups! This is so weird.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I was in charge of cups.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, okay, not so weird.
[Cut to another part of the room, Ross is going to talk to Joey.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Listen man, uh, I’m sorry the audition didn’t go so well.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah right! (Gets up for a refill to his snow cone.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No really, I-I am! I feel bad!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah? Well look Ross, you don’t have to. Okay? It’s not your fault I suck. I mean what kind of an actor can’t even say, “Hmm, noodle soup.” (Nods his head in disgust.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah y’know what? Maybe-maybe you didn’t mess up your audition because you suck, maybe you messed up because you care more about uh, your godson.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What you do mean?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I think, sub-consciously…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wait-whoa-whoa, you lost me.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I think on some level, you-you sabotaged your own audition so that Ben would get the part.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, you’re way sounds a lot better than mine. (Thinks about it.) Yeah. Yeah! It’s not that I’m a bad actor…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, it’s just ah, I care so damn much about little Ben that uh, it was more important to see him succeed.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: There you go. Thank you!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thank you! So, did-did he get it?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Eh, what are you gonna do?

content.description: The smoker’s balcony, Kim and Nancy are out smoking as Chandler sticks his head out the door.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, hi! Excuse me, is uh Rachel Green here? I was supposed to meet her for lunch.

content.speaker: Kim
content.text: Oh, she doesn’t come down here any more. You can find her up on ten.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, great.
(Kim exhales and Chandler stares at it longingly.)

content.speaker: Kim
content.text: So we talked about the (Chandler sneaks closer to her cigarette) whole presentation yesterday at lunch (Closer) and he wondered if one person would be enough (Closer) to get a take on the trip (Still closer) and I said, “Yeah, absolutely!” (She’s interrupted by Chandler who has reached his goal and takes a drag from her cancer stick.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’ll catch you guys later. (Exits.)
